content: If you would take the time to wath C-Span or read the transcripts from the House floor, you would see that the title of this thread was accurate. Congressman King from Iowa proposed an amendment excluding pediphilia as one of the "sexual preferences" protected under this bill. It was voted down by an almost straight party line vote. Then Congressman Gohmert asked to include "STATUS AS A CURRENT OR FORMER MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES, OR STATUS AS A LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER" into the bill and it was voted down, again by an almost straight party line vote. Here is a link to the text of the discussion and vote for Congressman Gohmert's amendment. The vote was 185 yeas, 241 nays. "http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/F?r111:6:./temp/~r111p5Kub7:e146965:" "http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/F?r111:6:./temp/~r111qk52iq:e170442:"

content: To me, this a prime (and ludicrous) example of the "slippery slope" of so-called "hate crimes" legislation. Everybody is "hated" by somebody somewhere out there to the point where they want to do violence against the "hatee". In the end, everyone could be covered as a protected class under hate crimes legislation, thus rendering the distinction meaningless. Crimes of violence against ANYONE for ANY REASON are by definition the ultimate manifestation of "hate". We don't need additional legislation to address this. A gay person who is murdered by a homophobe is just as dead as if was killed for his wallet. Anyone who kills for a wallet is just as depraved as the homophobe in my book This is more "feel good" crap from politicians and activists who have too much time on their hands.

content: To understand why I am against hate crime laws of any stripe, look at what has happened to the Canadians with their rediculous, extra-legal and appeal-free "human rights tribunals," where people can be and are being punished for speech that should be protected, primarily because it's seen as mean by some Muslims. That said, those of you who think this law covers or threatens speech in any way, you are dead wrong - unless vicious assault qualifies as speech to you. I don't want gays to be a protected class. I want them to be equal. Setting up socially weenie laws like this does not help that effort. It does not deter bad behavior, because people who want to kick someone's ass usually will do it regardless of the law, and it serves only to antagonize people who are gullible enough to be whipped into a frenzy by idiotic thread titles like this one.

content: If you would take the time to wath C-Span or read the transcripts from the House floor, you would see that the title of this thread was accurate. Congressman King from Iowa proposed an amendment excluding pediphilia as one of the "sexual preferences" protected under this bill. It was voted down by an almost straight party line vote. Then Congressman Gohmert asked to include "STATUS AS A CURRENT OR FORMER MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES, OR STATUS AS A LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER" into the bill and it was voted down, again by an almost straight party line vote. Here is a link to the text of the discussion and vote for Congressman Gohmert's amendment. The vote was 185 yeas, 241 nays. "http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/F?r111:6:./temp/~r111p5Kub7:e146965:" "http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/F?r111:6:./temp/~r111qk52iq:e170442:"

content: To me, this a prime (and ludicrous) example of the "slippery slope" of so-called "hate crimes" legislation. Everybody is "hated" by somebody somewhere out there to the point where they want to do violence against the "hatee". In the end, everyone could be covered as a protected class under hate crimes legislation, thus rendering the distinction meaningless. Crimes of violence against ANYONE for ANY REASON are by definition the ultimate manifestation of "hate". We don't need additional legislation to address this. A gay person who is murdered by a homophobe is just as dead as if was killed for his wallet. Anyone who kills for a wallet is just as depraved as the homophobe in my book This is more "feel good" crap from politicians and activists who have too much time on their hands.

content: To understand why I am against hate crime laws of any stripe, look at what has happened to the Canadians with their rediculous, extra-legal and appeal-free "human rights tribunals," where people can be and are being punished for speech that should be protected, primarily because it's seen as mean by some Muslims. That said, those of you who think this law covers or threatens speech in any way, you are dead wrong - unless vicious assault qualifies as speech to you. I don't want gays to be a protected class. I want them to be equal. Setting up socially weenie laws like this does not help that effort. It does not deter bad behavior, because people who want to kick someone's ass usually will do it regardless of the law, and it serves only to antagonize people who are gullible enough to be whipped into a frenzy by idiotic thread titles like this one.

content: If you would take the time to wath C-Span or read the transcripts from the House floor, you would see that the title of this thread was accurate. Congressman King from Iowa proposed an amendment excluding pediphilia as one of the "sexual preferences" protected under this bill. It was voted down by an almost straight party line vote. Then Congressman Gohmert asked to include "STATUS AS A CURRENT OR FORMER MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES, OR STATUS AS A LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER" into the bill and it was voted down, again by an almost straight party line vote. Here is a link to the text of the discussion and vote for Congressman Gohmert's amendment. The vote was 185 yeas, 241 nays. "http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/F?r111:6:./temp/~r111p5Kub7:e146965:" "http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/F?r111:6:./temp/~r111qk52iq:e170442:"

content: To me, this a prime (and ludicrous) example of the "slippery slope" of so-called "hate crimes" legislation. Everybody is "hated" by somebody somewhere out there to the point where they want to do violence against the "hatee". In the end, everyone could be covered as a protected class under hate crimes legislation, thus rendering the distinction meaningless. Crimes of violence against ANYONE for ANY REASON are by definition the ultimate manifestation of "hate". We don't need additional legislation to address this. A gay person who is murdered by a homophobe is just as dead as if was killed for his wallet. Anyone who kills for a wallet is just as depraved as the homophobe in my book This is more "feel good" crap from politicians and activists who have too much time on their hands.

content: To understand why I am against hate crime laws of any stripe, look at what has happened to the Canadians with their rediculous, extra-legal and appeal-free "human rights tribunals," where people can be and are being punished for speech that should be protected, primarily because it's seen as mean by some Muslims. That said, those of you who think this law covers or threatens speech in any way, you are dead wrong - unless vicious assault qualifies as speech to you. I don't want gays to be a protected class. I want them to be equal. Setting up socially weenie laws like this does not help that effort. It does not deter bad behavior, because people who want to kick someone's ass usually will do it regardless of the law, and it serves only to antagonize people who are gullible enough to be whipped into a frenzy by idiotic thread titles like this one.
